content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Ore Collection at Position (-14.5, -48.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (-15.0, -50.0) connected to a Wooden Chest at position (-14.5, -48.5) for collecting iron ore.

### Copper Ore Collection at Position (43.5, -79.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (43.5, -79.5) for collecting copper ore.

### Coal Mining and Smelting at Position (41.0, -82.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (41.0, -82.0) connected to a Stone Furnace at position (41.0, -80.0) for smelting operations.
- The Burner Mining Drill is currently out of fuel.

### Copper Smelting at Position (-20.0, -71.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (-20.0, -71.0) for smelting copper ore.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when placing entities on occupied tiles
- Ensure that the target tile is free of other entities before attempting to place a new entity. This will prevent errors related to occupied positions.

### Errors due to insufficient inventory items
- Always check your inventory to ensure you have the necessary items before attempting to insert them into machines or other entities. This will prevent errors related to missing items.

### Errors due to out of fuel
- Regularly check and refuel entities such as Burner Mining Drills and Furnaces to avoid interruptions in production due to lack of fuel.

## NAMESPACE

### Utility Functions
- `place_entity`: Used to place entities on the map. Ensure the target position is unoccupied to avoid placement errors.

### Important Variables
- `copper_chest_position`: Position variable used for placing the copper chest.
- `coal_drill`: Variable representing the coal mining drill, ensure it is properly fueled to maintain operation.
- `iron_furnace`: Variable representing the iron furnace, ensure it has sufficient fuel and ingredients for smelting operations.
